conclusion: The outer diameter of the sphere is twice the inner diameter, so if the inner radius is R, the outer radius is 2R.
The light enters at point A on the outer surface, making an angle of 45° with the normal.
Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2.
n1 is the refractive index of the first medium (vacuum, n1 = 1), θ1 is the angle of incidence (45°), n2 is the refractive index of the transparent material, θ2 is the angle of refraction.
The light just grazes the inner surface, meaning it travels along the tangent to the inner sphere.
The angle of refraction θ2 is such that the refracted ray is tangent to the inner sphere.
Using the right triangle: sin θ2 = R/2R = 1/2, thus θ2 = 30°.
Substitute the known values into Snell's Law: 1 * sin 45° = n2 * sin 30°.
The refractive index of the transparent material is √2.
